brain_cache.rule: Do not rely on Points, Badges, and Leaderboards (PBL) as the primary drivers of engagement; they are feedback mechanics, not motivation.
brain_cache.trigger: When designing a gamified system for long-term retention
brain_cache.verification: Audit system for 'Core Drives' beyond simple status indicators
brain_cache.red_flag: User engagement drops once rewards are achieved or removed

brain_cache.rule: Never prompt users to invite friends during onboarding; defer this request until after the 'First Major Win-State'.
brain_cache.trigger: Designing the 'Viral Loop' or referral flow
brain_cache.verification: Check flow diagrams to ensure social prompts occur after value delivery
brain_cache.red_flag: High drop-off rates at the 'Invite Friends' screen during signup

brain_cache.rule: Provide immediate 'Escape Hatches' (Undo, Cancel, Back) to allow users to explore without fear of irreversible consequences.
brain_cache.trigger: When designing complex workflows or editors
brain_cache.verification: Verify that every destructive action has a reversible state or confirmation
brain_cache.red_flag: Users hesitate to click features or repeatedly ask for confirmation

brain_cache.rule: Validate form inputs in real-time (after focus loss or during typing) rather than waiting for a full submit action.
brain_cache.trigger: Designing registration forms or data entry fields
brain_cache.verification: Test form with invalid data; error messages should appear immediately
brain_cache.red_flag: User completes a long form only to be rejected by a server-side error

brain_cache.rule: Use 'Generous Borders' and whitespace around tappable elements to accommodate inaccurate touch inputs.
brain_cache.trigger: Designing for mobile or touch interfaces
brain_cache.verification: Check tap targets against minimum size guidelines (e.g., 44px)

brain_cache.rule: Use Extrinsic Rewards (gift cards, money) to attract users, but transition quickly to Intrinsic Rewards (recognition, status) to prevent the Overjustification Effect.
brain_cache.trigger: Designing a rewards program or loyalty loop
brain_cache.verification: Map the user journey from 'Reward-based' to 'Activity-based' engagement
brain_cache.red_flag: Users stop performing the activity the moment the monetary reward stops

brain_cache.rule: Analyze unconventional design choices rather than just recreating polished interfaces to truly understand design nuances.
brain_cache.trigger: When attempting to improve UI design skills
brain_cache.verification: Review design case studies for 'why' decisions were made, not just 'how'
brain_cache.red_flag: Designs look 'clean' but fail to solve specific edge-case problems

brain_cache.rule: In long lists, allow users to type the first letter(s) of an item to immediately scroll to and select it.
brain_cache.trigger: Designing dropdowns, file finders, or long data lists
brain_cache.verification: Open list and type a character; focus should jump immediately
brain_cache.red_flag: Users are forced to scroll manually through hundreds of items
